rules.title: Wear a Helmet
rules.description: Always wear a helmet while riding a two-wheeler. Ensure the helmet meets safety standards and is properly fastened.

rules.title: Wear Seat Belts
rules.description: All passengers in a car must wear seat belts to ensure safety during sudden stops or collisions.

rules.title: Do Not Use Mobile Phones
rules.description: Avoid using mobile phones while driving. If necessary, use hands-free devices.

rules.title: Follow Speed Limits
rules.description: Adhere to the speed limits displayed on road signs. Over-speeding can lead to accidents and penalties.

rules.title: Avoid Drunk Driving
rules.description: Driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs is strictly prohibited and dangerous.

rules.title: Obey Traffic Lights
rules.description: Stop at red lights, slow down at yellow lights, and proceed only when the light is green.

rules.title: Do Not Honk Unnecessarily
rules.description: Avoid unnecessary honking, especially in silence zones near schools, hospitals, and residential areas.

rules.title: Carry Valid Documents
rules.description: Always carry your driving license, vehicle registration certificate, insurance papers, and pollution control certificate.

rules.title: Mandatory Signs
rules.description: These include signs like 'Stop', 'Give Way', and 'No Entry'. Follow these instructions without fail.

rules.title: Cautionary Signs
rules.description: These warn about potential hazards ahead, such as 'Sharp Turn' or 'School Zone'. Drive carefully.

rules.title: Informative Signs
rules.description: Provide information about distances, directions, or facilities like petrol pumps and hospitals.

rules.title: Speed Limit Signs
rules.description: Always follow the speed limits indicated on road signs to ensure safety and avoid fines.

rules.title: Lane Usage Signs
rules.description: Signs like 'Left Turn Only' or 'Straight Ahead Only' guide lane usage. Adhere to them for smooth traffic flow.

rules.title: Use Zebra Crossings
rules.description: Always cross the road at designated zebra crossings or pedestrian signals.

rules.title: Walk on Footpaths
rules.description: Use footpaths or sidewalks to stay safe from vehicular traffic.

rules.title: Be Alert at Intersections
rules.description: Look both ways before crossing roads at intersections.

rules.title: Avoid Distracted Walking
rules.description: Do not use mobile phones or headphones while crossing roads to stay alert.

rules.title: Follow Pedestrian Signals
rules.description: Cross only when the pedestrian signal turns green and wait if it’s red.

rules.title: Maintain a Safe Distance
rules.description: Keep a safe distance from the vehicle in front to avoid collisions.

rules.title: Use Indicators
rules.description: Always use indicators when turning or changing lanes to inform other road users.

rules.title: Check Blind Spots
rules.description: Always check blind spots before changing lanes or turning.

rules.title: Avoid Aggressive Driving
rules.description: Do not indulge in rash driving, overtaking in unsafe conditions, or road rage.

rules.title: Turn on Headlights at Dusk
rules.description: Switch on your headlights as soon as visibility reduces, even before it’s completely dark.

rules.title: Use Rearview Mirrors
rules.description: Regularly check your rearview mirrors to stay aware of surrounding vehicles.

rules.title: Avoid Tailgating
rules.description: Do not drive too close to the vehicle in front. Maintain a safe braking distance.

rules.title: Wear Reflective Clothing
rules.description: Use reflective clothing or stickers to increase visibility, especially at night.

rules.title: Avoid Overloading
rules.description: Do not carry more than one passenger or overload your vehicle.

rules.title: Stay in the Left Lane
rules.description: Ride in the leftmost lane and avoid overtaking unnecessarily.

rules.title: Regularly Maintain Your Bike
rules.description: Ensure your two-wheeler is in good condition by servicing it regularly.

rules.title: Use Both Brakes
rules.description: Apply both front and rear brakes together for effective braking and control.

rules.title: Keep Emergency Contacts
rules.description: Have a list of emergency contacts handy in case of an accident or breakdown.

rules.title: First Aid Kit
rules.description: Carry a first aid kit in your vehicle for emergencies.

rules.title: Use Hazard Lights
rules.description: Use hazard lights to warn other drivers if your vehicle breaks down.

rules.title: Know Emergency Numbers
rules.description: Familiarize yourself with emergency helpline numbers like 112 (national emergency) and 108 (ambulance).

rules.title: Learn Basic Vehicle Repairs
rules.description: Understand how to change a flat tire or jump-start your vehicle for minor emergencies.
